column11: Seventeen of us touring Jaffna visited the famous Casuarina Beach on 7th July 2019.  We paid a parking fee of Rs 100.00.  The entrance fee was Rs 20 per person. It was an attractive stretch of white sand.  The beach acquired its name from the pine-like casuarina trees planted on the shore.  The bright-blue waters were shallow, pleasing, enjoyable and warm.  People 75 metres in the sea could stand quite comfortably with head up.  The area for bathing is marked out by flags.  There is a "Surf Point" manned by lifeguards. The Changing facilities are basic.  Simple enclosures one each for Male and female. The scotting toilet facilities available are unclean. You can have a shower at a cost of Rs 40 each. Few shops about 75 metres from the beach provide for visitors' needs. There was a van selling ice cream. There was quite a crowd enjoying a swim in the evening in warm waters demonstrating that it is a popular spot.

column11: Casuarina beach is one of the best beaches in Sri Lanka. It's a great place to relax and have a swim in the evening and the water is about 25¬∞C, which is the optimum temperature to have a relaxing bath, according to my opinion. This beach is unknown to most of the tourists who come to Sri Lanka. The sea is quite shallow  and you can wade offshore for about 150 metres, when it's about 5 feet deep. The sea seems to be calm, something you won't find in most of the other beaches in Sri Lanka. One of the huge problems in this beach is the lack of an allocated place to keep your valuables while you bath. In the evening, you can see many people there enjoying and most of them don't leave until dusk. You can't visit there after sunset because there is no source of artificial light and also there can be some debris at times, which is not a considerable problem because when you compare it with the other beaches in Sri Lanka , this beach is cleaner and has less pollution. column11: Reaching Casuarina beach is a challenge, its about a 45 minute drive away from the city but the drive is scenic. Enjoy the views across the Jaffna lagoon when travelling on the causeway to Karainagar island. The beach opens to the public at 7am, we reached there bang on 7 and had the beach all to ourselves. Probably due to the time of year we were there, the wind was biting cold and the water was quite chilly. The sea is not the pool like calm that you would expect reading some of the reviews, it certainly has waves but the waves are not high and the water is not deep so you can go a fair distance in. My advice is that while this is a very enjoyable beach, its not fabulous enough on its own to warrant such a long drive from the city. Try combining your visit with other attractions in the area such as the Keerimalai hot springs, Dambakolapatuna, or maybe plan to have lunch at the Fort Hammenheil restaurant.
